pageContext.patina: Irregular, green and brown, some oxy-chloride present, surface filed here & there in modern times
pageContext.surface: Bad, parts covered with small blow holes and pitting.
pageContext.other: Under "Composition" the symbol [....] represents 1/8" - I was unable to get a conversion for this measurement.
pageContext.composition: Broken as shown; the cross-hatched blow holes are c. 1.27(left) and c. .63 (right) deep, the other c. [...] or less
pageContext.collection: BLACK GATE MUSEUM, 1958-4, NEWCASTLE upon TYNE, given to the Museum by Mr. R. J. Allen, Heatherlea, Lindisfarne Rd. N/c upon Tyne 2.
pageContext.site: (almost certainly from)- CUMBERLAND, Alston district, No record; found among the effects of the donor's father, a native of and resident in, Alston, associated with a stone axe hammer labeled 'From Alston".
pageContext.remarks: W. Bulmas. Hon. Curator B.G. Mus., Obviously a rejected casting; probably intended for re-melting, N/C upon Tyne.
